quote: My coat and I live comfortably togther. It has assumed all my wrinkles, does not hurt me anywhere, has moulded itself on my deformities, and is complacent to all my movements, and I only feel its presence because it keeps me warm. Old coats and old friends are the same thing.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: We should not let our fears hold us back from pursuing our hopes.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: We contend that for a nation to try to tax itself into prosperity is like a man standing in a bucket and trying to lift himself up
author: the handle. by Winston Churchill

quote: If a man does his best, what else is there?
author: George Patton

quote: When you're as great as I am, it's hard to be humble.
author: Muhammad Ali
